alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 10:51AM MST until further notice by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... Coeur d Alene River at Cataldo affecting Kootenai and Shoshone Counties. St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. .Over an inch of rain has fallen over North Idaho. Light to moderate rain will continue into Wednesday. Warmer temperatures and windy conditions will result in increasing snow melt. The combination of rain and snowmelt will result in excess runoff and potential for rivers to rise, some which could reach minor flood stage this week. For the St Joe...Coeur d`Alene...and Palouse Rivers...minor flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, Water will be up to Aqua Avenue in St Maries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM PST Tuesday the stage was 24.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 100 AM PST.
